description: Borrowed from Old Irish t√∫ath. Doublet of Deutsch and Dutch.

entries.meaning: (historical) A tribe or group of people in Ireland, having a loose voluntary system of governance entered into through contracts by all members.
examples: There was nothing fixed or enduring about many tuatha, and reflecting the itinerant character of much of Irish society, the Church developed the peculiar phenomenon of roving ecclesiastic families [...].
